title: The Music of the Ainur
summary: Eru Ilúvatar instructs the Ainur to sing the Great Music, envisioning the universe of Eä.

title: Eä Is Set in Motion
summary: Ilúvatar speaks 'Eä', granting reality to the Ainur’s vision. Those Ainur who enter become the Valar and Maiar.

title: The Valar Shape Arda
summary: Descending into the world, the Valar begin sculpting seas, lands, and mountains, setting the stage for life.

title: Melkor’s Discord
summary: Melkor disrupts the Valar's labors, bringing destruction and strife to Arda from the outset.

title: The Two Lamps: Illuin and Ormal
summary: To bring light to the world, the Valar raise two Lamps, later cast down by Melkor, reshaping the world.

title: Founding of Almaren
summary: The Valar dwell peacefully at Almaren until Melkor topples the Lamps, forcing their retreat to Aman.

title: Aman and Valinor Established
summary: The Valar fortify Aman and create Valinor as their home, secure from Melkor’s depredations.

title: The Two Trees of Valinor
summary: Yavanna grows Telperion and Laurelin, creating an era of blissful light in Valinor.

title: The Valar’s Vigil for the Children of Ilúvatar
summary: The Valar prepare for the awakening of Elves and Men, anticipating their arrival in Middle-earth.

title: The Awakening of the Elves at Cuiviénen
summary: The Firstborn awake under starlight by the waters of Cuiviénen, marking the dawn of Elvish history.

title: Melkor’s Shadow on the Elves
summary: Before the Valar find them, Melkor begins capturing and corrupting some Elves, sowing fear and discord.

title: The Great March of the Elves
summary: At the Valar’s invitation, many Elves undertake the journey west, eventually reaching Aman.

title: The Sundering of the Elves
summary: Some Elves remain behind (Avari), while others split into Vanyar, Noldor, and Teleri on the road west.

title: Establishment of the Elven Realms in Aman
summary: The Vanyar and Noldor settle in Tirion, while the Teleri build Alqualondë by the sea.

title: Melkor’s Imprisonment
summary: The Valar launch a war against Melkor, capture him, and hold him in chains for three ages in Valinor.

title: Building of Tirion and Formenos
summary: The Noldor under Finwë construct Tirion upon Túna. Fëanor later builds Formenos as a northern stronghold.

title: Melkor’s Feigned Repentance
summary: Melkor is eventually released but secretly plots revenge, stoking envy and strife among the Noldor.

title: Melkor and Fëanor’s Conflict
summary: Melkor whispers lies among the Noldor, inciting Fëanor’s pride and deepening hostilities.

title: Fëanor Forges the Silmarils
summary: Using the light of Telperion and Laurelin, Fëanor creates three jewels of unparalleled beauty and power.

title: Melkor and Ungoliant Destroy the Two Trees
summary: Melkor enlists Ungoliant, a monstrous spider, to poison and drain Telperion and Laurelin, casting Aman into darkness.

title: The Theft of the Silmarils and Murder of Finwë
summary: Melkor steals the Silmarils, slays Finwë, and flees. Fëanor names him Morgoth and vows vengeance.

title: Fëanor’s Oath
summary: Fëanor and his seven sons swear a terrible vow to reclaim the Silmarils, dooming themselves and others.

title: The Kinslaying at Alqualondë
summary: Seeking ships to chase Morgoth, Fëanor’s followers slay the Teleri, marking the first bloodshed among Elves.

title: The Prophecy of the North (Mandos’ Doom)
summary: Mandos pronounces a curse on the Noldor for the Kinslaying, foretelling sorrow and death in exile.

title: Crossing the Helcaraxë
summary: Fingolfin’s host traverses the deadly ice after Fëanor burns the ships, leaving them behind.

title: Fëanor’s Arrival in Beleriand
summary: Fëanor arrives and promptly battles Morgoth’s forces. Though victorious, Fëanor is mortally wounded.

title: Founding of Noldorin Realms
summary: Fingolfin’s people establish strongholds throughout Beleriand, including Gondolin and Nargothrond.

title: Siege of Angband
summary: The Noldor lay siege to Morgoth’s fortress, enjoying a long watchful peace despite constant tension.

title: The Sun and Moon Arise
summary: Following the Trees’ destruction, the Valar fashion the vessels of the Sun and Moon, bringing new light.

title: Men Awaken and Enter Beleriand
summary: The Edain arrive, forging alliances with Elves and settling in various regions of Beleriand.

title: Morgoth Breaks the Siege (Dagor Bragollach)
summary: The Battle of Sudden Flame shatters the long siege; balrogs, dragons, and orcs swarm Elven realms.

title: The Founding of Gondolin
summary: Turgon discovers a hidden valley and builds Gondolin, a secret stronghold and beacon of hope.

title: Barahir’s Stand and the Ring of Barahir
summary: Barahir resists Morgoth’s forces; his ring passes to his son Beren, shaping future quests.

title: Beren and Lúthien’s Quest for the Silmaril
summary: A mortal Man and an Elf-maiden undertake a perilous journey to reclaim a Silmaril from Morgoth’s crown.

title: The Fall of Nargothrond
summary: Túrin’s counsel inadvertently aids Glaurung’s assault, leading to the downfall of the hidden fortress.

title: The Children of Húrin
summary: Under Morgoth’s curse, Túrin’s tragic fate unfolds, culminating in sorrow and loss.

title: The Quest of Eärendil
summary: Eärendil, bearing a Silmaril, voyages to Aman seeking the Valar’s aid against Morgoth.

title: The Fall of Gondolin
summary: Morgoth’s servants infiltrate the hidden city; Gondolin is destroyed, survivors flee to Sirion.

title: War of Wrath Begins
summary: Moved by Eärendil’s plea, the Valar send a massive army to Middle-earth to confront Morgoth.

title: Defeat of Morgoth and Breaking of Thangorodrim
summary: Morgoth is overthrown, cast beyond the world’s Walls; Beleriand is largely sunk beneath the sea.

title: End of the First Age
summary: With Morgoth vanquished, the Valar declare the First Age ended. Many Elves depart for Aman.

title: Rise of Númenor
summary: As a gift for their valor, the Edain receive Númenor, blessed with long lifespans and prosperity.

title: Founding of Lindon
summary: Gil-galad establishes Lindon as the last realm of the Noldor in the west after Beleriand’s destruction.

title: Sauron Emerges as the New Dark Power
summary: With Morgoth gone, Sauron rises to dominate Middle-earth, building armies and forging alliances.

title: Eregion (Hollin) Established
summary: Celebrimbor and other Elven-smiths found Eregion, forging close friendship with the Dwarves of Khazad-dûm.

title: Annatar, the Lord of Gifts
summary: Sauron deceives the Elves in fair form, teaching ring-lore and guiding them to craft Rings of Power.

title: Forging of the Rings of Power
summary: Many Rings of Power are made; Celebrimbor secretly forges the Three Elven Rings without Sauron’s direct influence.

title: The One Ring Is Forged
summary: Sauron invests much of his power into the One Ring, seeking dominion over those who bear the lesser rings.

title: Celebrimbor Discovers Sauron’s Deceit
summary: Realizing the One Ring’s creation, Celebrimbor hides the Three Rings, but war soon ensues.

title: Sack of Eregion
summary: Sauron’s forces destroy Eregion; Celebrimbor is slain. The surviving Elves flee or seek refuge elsewhere.

title: Númenórean Intervention
summary: Númenor sends great fleets that push back Sauron’s forces, granting a temporary reprieve to Middle-earth.

title: Númenor’s Increasing Pride
summary: Wealth and power grow, but many resent the Ban of the Valar forbidding westward voyages to Aman.

title: Sauron’s Influence in Númenor
summary: Ar-Pharazôn captures Sauron but is corrupted by him, leading Númenor toward darkness and hubris.

title: The Temple to Morgoth and Persecution of the Faithful
summary: Under Sauron’s guidance, Ar-Pharazôn erects a temple to Morgoth; the Faithful are hunted or slain.

title: The Downfall of Númenor
summary: Ar-Pharazôn sails to Aman in defiance; Eru Ilúvatar causes Númenor’s destruction, reshaping the world.

title: Refugees in Middle-earth
summary: Elendil and his sons escape Númenor’s ruin, founding the realms of Arnor (north) and Gondor (south).

title: The Last Alliance of Elves and Men
summary: Seeing Sauron’s renewed threat, Elves and Men unite in a grand alliance to challenge him.

title: Siege of Barad-dûr
summary: The forces of the Last Alliance besiege Sauron’s stronghold for seven years, suffering many losses.

title: Isildur Takes the One Ring
summary: Sauron is overthrown; Isildur claims the Ring as weregild for his father, failing to destroy it.

title: End of the Second Age
summary: With Sauron’s defeat, the Second Age concludes, though evil persists in the One Ring.

title: Foundation of Arnor and Gondor
summary: The Dúnedain realms flourish initially; Arnor in the north, Gondor in the south.

title: Decline of Arnor
summary: Internal strife causes Arnor to split into Arthedain, Cardolan, and Rhudaur, weakening the north.

title: The Nazgûl Appear
summary: Sauron’s nine Ringwraiths begin active operations in Middle-earth, heralding a new shadow.

title: The Witch-king Founds Angmar
summary: The chief Nazgûl establishes Angmar, waging relentless war against the weakened northern Dúnedain.

title: Fall of Arthedain
summary: Despite aid from Lindon and Rivendell, Arthedain is overrun by Angmar; the line of Isildur survives in secret.

title: White Council Formed
summary: The Wise unite to counter the growing shadow of Sauron, meeting periodically to deliberate plans.

title: The Istari (Wizards) Arrive
location: Landing in the Havens, spread across Middle-earth
summary: Five Maiar spirits are sent to aid the Free Peoples against Sauron’s resurgence, taking mortal forms.

title: Gondor’s Zenith
summary: Gondor reaches peak power under Ship-kings and able rulers, building might and vast fleets.

title: Great Plague
summary: A devastating plague spreads through Middle-earth, weakening Gondor and depopulating many regions.

title: Eorl the Young and the Éothéod
summary: Eorl rides south to aid Gondor at the Field of Celebrant; Cirion grants them Calenardhon, renamed Rohan.

title: The Golden Hall of Meduseld
summary: King Eorl establishes Rohan’s capital at Edoras, building the royal hall Meduseld.

title: Durin’s Bane Awakens
summary: Dwarves delve too deep and awaken a Balrog, forcing them to flee Khazad-dûm; it becomes known as Moria.

title: Saruman Occupies Isengard
summary: Saruman is granted the keys of Orthanc, eventually fortifying Isengard as his own power base.

title: The Shadow Grows in Dol Guldur
summary: A dark power, revealed later as Sauron, occupies Dol Guldur, spreading fear and corruption.

title: White Council Drives Sauron from Dol Guldur
summary: Prompted by Gandalf, the Council attacks Dol Guldur. Sauron retreats to Mordor, planning open war.

title: Smaug Seizes Erebor
summary: Smaug drives out the Dwarves, hoarding vast treasure and desolating Dale.

title: The Quest of Erebor
summary: Thorin and company set out with Bilbo to reclaim the Lonely Mountain, culminating in Smaug’s defeat.

title: The Battle of Five Armies
summary: Dwarves, Elves, and Men unite against Orcs and Wargs. Thorin falls, but the north sees renewed peace.

title: Bilbo’s Discovery of the One Ring
summary: During the Quest of Erebor, Bilbo stumbles upon Gollum’s ring, not yet knowing it is the One Ring.

title: Arnor’s Heir in Rivendell
summary: Aragorn, Isildur’s heir, is raised in secret by Elrond, preparing for a future destiny.

title: Gandalf Suspects Bilbo’s Ring
summary: Noticing Bilbo’s prolonged youth and odd behavior, Gandalf grows wary that the magic ring is more than it seems.

title: Sauron Publicly Declares Himself in Mordor
summary: Openly rebuilding Barad-dûr, Sauron gathers forces, no longer hiding his presence.

title: Bilbo’s Farewell Party and Frodo’s Inheritance
summary: Bilbo vanishes using the Ring, leaving it to Frodo. Gandalf confirms it is the One Ring soon after.

title: The Formation of the Fellowship
summary: At the Council of Elrond, representatives of the Free Peoples decide to destroy the Ring in Mount Doom.

title: The Fellowship’s Journey
summary: Traversing Moria (losing Gandalf to the Balrog), then Lothlórien, the Fellowship breaks at Amon Hen.

title: Gandalf the White
summary: After defeating the Balrog, Gandalf is sent back as Gandalf the White, taking Saruman’s place among the Wise.

title: The Ents’ March on Isengard
summary: Roused by Merry and Pippin, the Ents storm Isengard, trapping Saruman in Orthanc.

title: Rohan’s Victory at Helm’s Deep
summary: Théoden’s Rohirrim, aided by Gandalf, defeat Saruman’s army at the Hornburg.

title: The Siege of Minas Tirith
summary: Sauron’s massive host attacks Gondor. Rohan’s arrival and Aragorn’s reinforcements turn the tide.

title: Destruction of the One Ring
summary: Frodo and Sam reach the Cracks of Doom; Gollum seizes the Ring and falls into the fire, unmaking Sauron.

title: Aragorn Crowned as King Elessar
summary: With Sauron defeated, Aragorn takes up the crown, beginning the Reunited Kingdom of Arnor and Gondor.

title: The Last Battle Before the Black Gate
summary: The Free Peoples draw out Sauron’s armies to buy Frodo time; the battle ends with the Ring’s destruction.

title: Wedding of Aragorn and Arwen
summary: The long-prophesied union of Man and Elf-maiden ushers in an era of hope and unity.

title: Saruman’s Downfall in the Shire
summary: Saruman, having fled Orthanc, briefly terrorizes the Shire. The hobbits rally and end his rule.

title: Return of the Hobbits
summary: The hobbits restore order after Saruman’s defeat, healing the hurts inflicted on the Shire.

title: Galadriel and Elrond Depart
summary: Many great Elves, along with Gandalf, sail west from the Grey Havens, marking the Eldar’s waning.

title: Frodo and Bilbo Depart
summary: Wounded in body and spirit, Frodo joins Bilbo and the Elves on a ship to the Undying Lands.

title: Aragorn’s Reign and the Reunited Kingdom
summary: As King Elessar, Aragorn ushers in an era of peace, rebuilding and uniting the realms of Men.

title: Legolas and Gimli’s Journey
summary: After Aragorn’s death, Legolas sails west with Gimli, an unprecedented honor for a Dwarf.

title: Dawn of the Fourth Age
summary: With Sauron vanquished, Men become central to Arda’s future. The Elves continue to depart.

title: Birth of Fëanor
summary: Fëanor is born to Finwë and Míriel; his fiery spirit will shape Elven history.

title: Birth of Galadriel
summary: Galadriel (Artanis) is born in Aman, destined to become a mighty leader among the Exiled Noldor.

title: Founding of Rivendell (Imladris)
summary: After Eregion’s fall, Elrond establishes the refuge of Imladris (Rivendell), a haven for Elves.

title: Minas Ithil Becomes Minas Morgul
summary: Sauron’s forces capture Minas Ithil, corrupting it into Minas Morgul, seat of the Witch-king.

title: Coronation of King Helm Hammerhand
summary: Helm ascends the throne in Rohan, later associated with epic stands at the fortress bearing his name.

title: Arvedui Claims the Throne of Gondor
summary: Arvedui, last King of Arthedain, attempts to unify the kingdoms, but the claim is rejected.

title: Birth of Aragorn II (Elessar)
summary: Aragorn is born into the lineage of Isildur, set to become the key figure in the War of the Ring.

title: Gollum Finds the Ring
summary: Sméagol murders Déagol for the Ring, beginning his slow transformation into Gollum.

title: Restoration of Orthanc to the King
summary: Aragorn reclaims Orthanc, clearing out Saruman’s remnants; Gimli and Legolas aid in repairs.

title: Eldarion Becomes King
summary: Aragorn passes, and Eldarion, son of Aragorn and Arwen, inherits the throne, continuing the Reunited Kingdom.
